column4: Hello. I want to run a SMART self test on my notebook's hd. But  smartctl said "device doesn't support SMART". Is this caused by the drive or the kernel (2.6.20 from 7.0.4)?
Hello. I installed 7.04 on my notebook. After ~2 minutes of inactivity the creen goes black. Wheere can I set this value and how can I force it to "dpms off"?
screen*
Hello. Do I have to restart any daemons after a change of /etc/logrotate.conf?
proberly should.
What do you mean "proberly should"?
some demons dont need it.. many (most) do.
ext2/3 or if shareing btween different machines - could use vfat
sort of depends on what youa re doing wih the sticks.
I just want to the stick to share data between different ubuntu machines (and users). Could there be any problems when using ext?
with ext2 it WILL  keep ownership and permissions.. thus user bob may or may not be able to read/write user Bubba's files on that stick
if just using it to transfer files  and you want everyone to read them with no hassles.. vfat prioberly is the best bet
if it messed up you can always try other fs's later.. not likt its hard to change them
ok, thanks. I just thought there was a (usable) OSS alternative to vfat ...
ext2 and 3 are useable.. but as i said.. a Linux native FS  - WILL keep ownership/permissions - that may be a good thing.. or bad thing.. depending on your needs
i belive compiz has a window-rules plugin  that can do some of that.  theres also an app called 'devilspie' i think thaat can tweak those settings
you have to use some command line options to enable it i belive. im not even sureit appears in the plugins list then
I tested on several sites. It seems to be disabled.
None. `man google-chrome` doesnâ€™t mention flash.
then thats why its not working.
Do you know how?
seen guides on it at webupd8 or omgubuntu.. i never tried it
http://support.google.com/chrome/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=108086 says it should be enabled by default.
never noticed or tried. Im back to using firefox these days
